articles.title: Tracking the Thanksgiving weekend weather
articles.description: This Thanksgiving was one of the coldest for people across the Northeast. CBS New York’s chief weathercaster Lonnie Quinn has the forecast.

articles.title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Thursday, November 22, 2018
articles.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News."

articles.title: Millions brave frigid temperatures to watch annual Thanksgiving Day parade
articles.description: This year, an estimated 3 million people bundled up outside to watch the annual Thanksgiving Day parade in New York City. Right up until the parade started, officials hoped the winds would cooperate. CBS News correspondent Don Dahler reports.

articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.title: Woman ordered to repay stolen money from Girl Scout cookie funds
articles.description: Jennifer L. Hooten of Clifton, Colorado, pleaded guilty to felony theft Sept. 13 and was ordered to pay $1,400 in restitution
articles.content: GRAND JUNCTION, Colo. — A Colorado woman has pleaded guilty to charges of embezzling Girl Scout cookie funds from her daughter's troop. The Daily Sentinel reported Wednesday that Jennifer L. Hooten, 32, of Clifton pleaded guilty to felony theft Sept. 13 and w… [+946 chars]

articles.title: Former President Barack Obama visits Chicago food bank
articles.description: Former President Barack Obama got into the holiday spirit this week, surprising star-struck volunteers and helping them prepare Thanksgiving meals at a Chicago food bank.

articles.title: Amazon data breach exposes customer names, emails
articles.description: Amazon said a technical error on its website exposed the names and email addresses of some customers. The online retail giant its website and systems weren't hacked.

articles.title: First responders use Thanksgiving to serve California wildfire survivors

articles.title: Woman in burning Dallas apartment drops baby to bystander
articles.description: Six residents of a Dallas apartment complex leaped from third-floor windows onto mattresses, and a woman dropped her baby to a bystander to escape the flames.  Authorities say three people, including a firefighter, suffered minor injuries.
